titleStmt.title: Loyalty unfeigned, or, The true Protestants admonition. Being a pleasant new song. Two dangerous rocks on either hand appear, we now 'twixt Scilla and Caribdis steer, our pilot's care (you'l say) had need be great it had so, for on each hand stands a fate. On either hand to saile we suffer wrack, either to starboard or the larboard tack, therefore in wisdom he has thought it best to saile foreright, for there the danger's least. To the tune of, Busie fame, Young Pheon, or, The fathers exhortation.
